comments.author: bemguard-bugzilla@yahoo.ca
comments.creator: bemguard-bugzilla@yahoo.ca
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/4.0b13pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/4.0b13pre

At the cited page, hover over any of the links to the ringtone downloads and you'll see a weird strike-through happening in the text of the lines.

For some reason Minefield Trunk and Mozilla 3.6 seem to be putting a text underline for the very small speaker graphic in the text of the line below.

There's nothing in any of the CSS that I can find that indicates why it is doing this.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Go to webpage
2.Hover over a ringtone link

Actual Results:  
An underline gets created for the speaker symbol, which is drawn in the text below it.

Expected Results:  
Looking at this page in IE8 and Chrome 10, both browsers don't seem to put an underline in for the speaker symbol.

Looking at this page in Safari 5.03 on Windows, an underline is actually created for the speaker symbol, but it doesn't interfere with the text below.

Either of the above would seem to make more sense than what is happening here.

Screenshots to come
